meanings.definition: A North African fortress or citadel
meanings.sent1: The ancient casbah stood proudly on the hill, overlooking the city.
meanings.sent2: Tourists marveled at the historic casbah during their visit to Morocco.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek in the casbah, pretending to be knights.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a casbah of secrets, each room holding a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun cast a warm glow on the casbah, making it look magical.

meanings.definition: A marketplace or quarter in a North African city, especially in Algiers
meanings.sent1: The bustling casbah was filled with colorful stalls selling spices and textiles.
meanings.sent2: Locals frequented the casbah to buy fresh produce and handmade crafts.
meanings.sent3: The street performers entertained the crowd in the lively casbah square.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the casbah was a treasure trove of exotic goods waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of spices wafted through the narrow alleys of the casbah, enticing passersby.
